detail.content: Education | Biochemistry and Molecular Pharmacology                                Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             Biochemistry and Molecular Pharmacology                                                                                  Home   About Us   Faculty   Research   Education   Contact Us                                  Home Education            Print  Email               - A + A                                         Education      Cellular and Molecular Biology Training Program     open/close   Molecular Pharmacology Training Program                                                                                                    Education                                                      Faculty in the Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Pharmacology participate in the training of a variety of pre- and post-doctoral students. There are also opportunities for undergraduates to participate in summer research. Please follow these links for detailed information on each of these high-ranking programs.   Graduate Degree (PhD)   Combined Medical & Graduate Degree (MD/PhD)   Summer Undergraduate Research Program (SURP)   Medical Degree (MD)   Doctoral (PhD) Training Programs   The Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Pharmacology administers the Molecular Pharmacology and Signal Transduction training program , which is supported in part by a prestigious T32 training grant from the NIH.   Faculty in the Department are also members of other PhD graduate training programs in the Sackler Institute at NYU School of Medicine, or belong to multiple programs. These training programs are:   Biomedical Informatics   Cellular and Molecular Biology   Computational Biology   Developmental Genetics   Microbiology   Molecular Biophysics   Molecular Oncology and Tumor Immunology   Neuroscience and Physiology   Stem Cell Biology   Admission Requirements / How to Apply   Degree Program/Curriculum   Graduate Advisors Contact Information   Admissions Information (current info)                                                                                        NYU Langone Medical Center       Student Login       Library                 Policies & Disclaimers

Faculty | Biochemistry and Molecular Pharmacology                                Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             Biochemistry and Molecular Pharmacology                                                                                  Home   About Us   Faculty   Research   Education   Contact Us                                  Home Faculty            Print  Email               - A + A                                         Faculty      Primary Faculty   Emeritus Faculty   Secondary Faculty   Adjunct Faculty                                                                                                    Faculty                                                      The Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Pharmacology is formed of faculty with primary , secondary and adjunct appointments.   The faculty have active research laboratories located primarily on the “superblock” of the NYU Langone Medical Center, but are also located in adjacent buildings and on the Washington Square campus. Along with their research pursuits, the faculty are also engaged in the instruction of medical and graduate students. The teaching expertise of departmental faculty ranges from molecular mechanisms in biochemistry and pharmacology, to advanced topics in genetics, neurobiology, and signal transduction and receptor biology.                                                                                        NYU Langone Medical Center       Student Login       Library                 Policies & Disclaimers

Biochemistry and Molecular Pharmacology | Biochemistry and Molecular Pharmacology                                 Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             Biochemistry and Molecular Pharmacology                                                                                  Home   About Us   Faculty   Research   Education   Contact Us                                  Home Home            Print  Email               - A + A                                                                                                                                           Biochemistry and Molecular Pharmacology                                                      As science progresses and evolves, so has the Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Pharmacology. Formed in 2012 from the merger of the Departments of Biochemistry and Pharmacology, we now have active programs in a wide range of contemporary topics including structural biology, single molecule imaging, and drug design for therapies against infectious and neurological diseases. Dr. Phillip Sharp was the guest speaker, hosted by Dr. Danny Reinberg. The Molecular Pharmacology Training Program at the NYU Sackler Institute of Graduate Biomedical Sciences | Biochemistry and Molecular Pharmacology                                Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             Biochemistry and Molecular Pharmacology                                                                                  Home   About Us   Faculty   Research   Education   Contact Us                                  Home Education Molecular Pharmacology Training Program            Print  Email               - A + A                                         Education      Cellular and Molecular Biology Training Program     open/close   Molecular Pharmacology Training Program  Program Faculty Research Interests   Program Overview and Qualifying Exam Guidelines   Thesis Committee Report   Molecular Pharmacology Brochure   Postdoctoral Fellows                                                                                                      The Molecular Pharmacology Training Program at the NYU Sackler Institute of Graduate Biomedical Sciences                                                      Erika Bach , PhD, Graduate Director (Office hours: Thursday 3-5pm, MSB 497B)   Gregory David , PhD, Graduate Advisor (Office hours: Tuesday 2-4pm)   General Information   Faculty Research and Interests   Pre-doctoral Training Plan   General Requirements   General Information   The goal of our program is to train a new generation of scientists in molecular and biochemical pharmacology and drug discovery in five major areas:   Cancer Signaling Pathways and Targets   Structural Biology, Bioinformatics and Drug Design   Receptor Pharmacology and Therapeutics   Development of Therapeutics   Pharmacology of Neurodegenerative Disorders   Our faculty are internationally recognized scientists. We have trained more than 85 PhD & MD/PhD students. We are the recipient of a prestigious NIH training grant.   Research experience may be acquired in these areas:   Growth-factor-mediated signal transduction   Tyrosine kinase receptors   RNAi technology   Medical chemistry   Genomic stability   Transcriptional regulation   Steroid/nuclear hormone receptors   Toxicology   Proteomics   Protein structure   Informatics   Pre-doctoral Training Plan   Year 1   * indicates a required course   Fall  Laboratory Rotation I (begin October)  * Foundations I (Biochemistry and Molecular Biology)  * Scientific Methods: Survival Techniques   Spring  Laboratory Rotation II (begin January) and III (begin April)  * Pharmacology and Drug Development (or in Spring Yr2)  * Scientific Integrity & Responsible Conduct of Research  Foundations II (or other elective)   Summer  Finish laboratory rotation III and choose thesis lab   Year 2   Fall  Training in pre-doctoral laboratory  * Biostatistics and Bioinformatics for Biologists (or Fall Yr1)  Elective course  Work-in-Progress   Spring  Training in pre-doctoral laboratory  *Principles of Protein Modifications in Health and Disease  Work-in-Progress   Summer  Qualifying Exam (must be taken by Dec 31 of 3rd year)  Year 3 until graduation  Training in pre-doctoral laboratory  Research in Pharmacology  Seminar in Pharmacology  Work-in-Progress  Thesis Committee Meetings (twice a year)   Examples of elective courses   Foundations II (Cell Biology and Genetics)   Cellular Neuroscience   Stem Cells   Molecular Mechanisms in Biology   Molecular Oncology   Other opportunities   Departmental and institute seminars   National, international meetings   Career development seminars   Skirball Symposium   General Requirements   Completion of 72 graduate credits of which at least 32 must be in course work   Successful passing of a qualifying examination   University acceptance of a dissertation   Students with disabilities are welcome to apply.                                                                                        NYU Langone Medical Center       Student Login       Library                 Policies & Disclaimers
